intro: Phlegmariurus longus, commonly known as the long-stemmed clubmoss, is a species of vascular plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive morphology, featuring a creeping stem with whorls of narrow, needle-like leaves. Its sporophylls are arranged in clusters and produce spores, which are dispersed by wind. Phlegmariurus longus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
